document_data.caption: The deaf-mute orphan [[Tira]], with her hearing-ear dog [[Bounder]], practices drow sign language with [[Valandrin Telenna]].
document_data.name: Sign Language
document_data.mainbody: A '''sign language''' was a system of communication involving hand and other gestures. They were used by [[deaf]] and mute people and those who learned it to communicate with them, and by people wishing to communicate in silence or secrecy. Several different forms of sign language were used on [[Toril]].<ref group="note">Sign languages have been mentioned a number of times in ''Forgotten Realms'' sources, but have not always been named or described. As such, it is unclear if they should be treated as the same, similar, or unrelated sign languages, while some are confirmed to be unique. For convenience, this article collects these various unnamed sign languages together. Named and unrelated sign languages are detailed on their own pages. Basic signals and instances of improvised signing, such as by miming, are not included. Such forms of communication were also called '''silent languages'''.

Users.Custom:
[[Carsten]] and [[Silke]], two [[wizard]]s held captive in a ''[[silence]]''-affected cell in [[Ronras Prison]], created a complex sign language to communicate.<ref>{{Cite organized play/LC/What The??|8}} 

[[Nat]], a deaf street urchin girl of [[Waterdeep]] in the late 1400s DR, devised her own sign language to communicate with her friends.<ref>

In [[Chult]], [[Qawasha]], a [[human]] [[druid]], and [[Kupalu√©]], a [[vegepygmy]], communicated to one another using their own form of sign language.<ref>

As [[saurial]]s could not speak [[Common]], [[Alias]] taught [[Dragonbait]] a variant of the thieves' hand cant so he could communicate with her and [[Olive Ruskettle]] (who was annoyed at the sharing of thieves' secrets).

'Silent signs' were employed for secret communication among the Harpers, [[Zhentarim]], agents of the [[Lords' Alliance]], and other cabals, guilds, and groups.

[[Wayfinder]]s, a unique [[dwarf|dwarven]] variety of rogue that were quite proficient in learning other languages, sometimes knew sign languages.<ref>
Users.Ape: [[Carnivorous ape]]s could communicate in a sign language.<ref>{{Cite organized play/LC/Going Ape|3,10}}
Users.Elven Language:
[[Katyr Toralynnsyr]], a mute [[copper elf]] scout of the [[Elmanesse]] tribe of the [[Forest of Tethir]], used a simple sign language. His wife [[Annelwin Toralynnsyr]] translated for outsiders.<ref><ref>{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1992|102|Katyr}}

[[Vander Stillhawk]], a [[ranger]] of [[Tethyr]], used a detailed sign language taught to him by elves after [[orc]]s cut out his tongue as a boy. [[Zaranda Star]], Father [[Pelletyr]], and his other adventuring companions also learned this language.<ref>
Users.Netherese: [[Cragh]], a deaf-mute [[Netherese]] [[arcanist]] of the [[Golden Age of Netheril|Golden Age]] of [[Netheril]], communicated in a sign language.<ref>
Users.Planar:
[[Elliach]], a mage of the [[Wandering Emporium]] in [[Avernus]] who worked mutating [[demon ichor]], was left deaf after his ears grew wings and flew off, so he used a strange form of sign language, owing to his tentacle-like fingers.<ref><ref>{{Cite adventurers league/Faces of Fortune|9-10}}

[[Lillend]]i as a whole had an uncanny ability to understand all forms of sign language presented to them.<ref>
Users.Wa-an: In [[Aru]] in [[Wa]], [[Fusae]], the mute proprietress of the [[House of Heavenly Sand]], communicated in a clumsy sign language. Her granddaughter [[Cachiko]] interpreted for customers as needed.<ref>
Users.Zakharan: [[Bashi]], a [[mamluk]] guard of [[Mabruk al-Hanash]]'s home in [[Dihliz]], was mute and communicated via a sign language.<ref>
